original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i lo'i dang po dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i lo'i dang po dri bar bya'o //
translated: “You should ask about the first year of full ordination.”

original: dge slong rnams kyis ji ltar dri ba ma shes nas /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis ji ltar dri ba ma shes nas /
translated: The monks did not know how to ask,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: and the Blessed One said,

original: re zhig dang por dus tshigs dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: re zhig dang por dus tshigs dri bar bya'o //
translated: “First, you should ask about the season.”

original: dge slong rnams kyis dus tshigs du yin pa mi shes nas /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis dus tshigs du yin pa mi shes nas /
translated: The monks did not know which season it was,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: and the Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag /🔽dus tshigs ni /
analyzed: dge slong dag / dus tshigs ni /
translated: “Monks,🔽there are

original: lnga po 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: lnga po 'di dag yin te /
translated: five seasons:

original: dgun dang / sos ka dang / dbyar dang / dbyar thung ngu dang / dbyar ring po'o //
analyzed: dgun dang / sos ka dang / dbyar dang / dbyar thung ngu dang / dbyar ring po'o //
translated: winter, spring, summer, short summer, and long summer.

original: de la zla ba bzhi ni /
analyzed: de la zla ba bzhi ni /
translated: Four months

original: dgun yin no //
analyzed: dgun yin no //
translated: are winter.

original: zla ba bzhi ni /
analyzed: zla ba bzhi ni /
translated: Four months

original: sos ka yin no //
analyzed: sos ka yin no //
translated: are spring.🔽One month

original: zla ba gcig ni /
analyzed: zla ba gcig ni /
translated: One month.🔽🔽

original: dbyar yin no //
analyzed: dbyar yin no //
translated: It is summer.

original: nyin zhag gcig ni /
analyzed: nyin zhag gcig ni /
translated: One day

original: dbyar thung ngu yin no //
analyzed: dbyar thung ngu yin no //
translated: is a short summer day.

original: zla ba gsum du zhag gcig gis ma tshang ba ni /
analyzed: zla ba gsum du zhag gcig gis ma tshang ba ni /
translated: Three months less one day

original: dbyar ring po yin te /
analyzed: dbyar ring po yin te /
translated: is a long summer.

original: de ltar dus tshigs de brjod nas sngar @282b bsnyen par rdzogs pa gang yin pa de la phyag bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar dus tshigs de brjod nas sngar @282b bsnyen par rdzogs pa gang yin pa de la phyag bya'o //
translated: Having thus described the seasons, one should pay homage to the one who was first ordained.

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Monks,

original: gzhan yang / phyag bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang / phyag bya ba ni /

original: bzhi ste / bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi ste / bzhi gang zhe na /

original: re zhig 'jig rten lha dang bcas pa /
analyzed: re zhig 'jig rten lha dang bcas pa /
translated: First, the one who is to be paid homage by the world with its gods,

original: bdud dang bcas pa /🔽tshangs pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: bdud dang bcas pa / tshangs pa dang bcas pa /
translated: with Māra, Brahmā,🔽and with the ascetics and brahmins,

analyzed: dge sbyong dang bram ze dang bcas pa'i skye rgu dang / lha dang mir bcas pas phyag bya ba /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / khyim pa thams cad kyis phyag bya ba /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / khyim pa thams cad kyis phyag bya ba /
translated: is the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.🔽Second, the one who is to be paid homage by all householders,

original: rab tu byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa thams cad kyis phyag bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa thams cad kyis phyag bya ba ni /
translated: by all renunciants and fully ordained monks,

original: sngar bsnyen par rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar bsnyen par rdzogs pa yin no //

original: dge slong ma ma gtogs te /
analyzed: dge slong ma ma gtogs te /

original: de ni / bsnyen par rdzogs nas lo brgya lon kyang de ring bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i dge slong la phyag bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni / bsnyen par rdzogs nas lo brgya lon kyang de ring bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i dge slong la phyag bya ba yin no //
translated: Even if she has been fully ordained for one hundred years, she should bow down to a fully ordained monk who was ordained that very day.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa thams cad kyis phyag bya ba /
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa thams cad kyis phyag bya ba /
translated: All those who are not fully ordained should bow down to those who are fully ordained.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa'o //🔽phyag mi bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa'o // phyag mi bya ba ni /
translated: One who is fully ordained is one who has taken the full complement of vows.

original: bcu ste / bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu ste / bcu gang zhe na /
translated: One should not bow down to ten types of persons:

original: spo ba pa dang / gzhi nas spo ba dang / spo ba spyad pa dang / mgu ba spyod pa dang / mgu bar bya ba spyad pa dang / ma mthong bas gnas nas phyung ba dang / phyir mi byed pas gnas nas phyung ba dang /
analyzed: spo ba pa dang / gzhi nas spo ba dang / spo ba spyad pa dang / mgu ba spyod pa dang / mgu bar bya ba spyad pa dang / ma mthong bas gnas nas phyung ba dang / phyir mi byed pas gnas nas phyung ba dang /
translated: those who are undergoing probation, those who are undergoing the trial period, those who are engaged in the trial period, those who are engaged in the process of reconciliation, those who are engaged in the process of acknowledgment, those who have been ejected for not recognizing an offense, those who have been ejected for not making amends for an offense,

original: sdig pa'i lta bar song ba mi 'dor ba gnas nas phyung ba dang / khyim pa thams cad dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa ma yin pa thams cad do //
analyzed: sdig pa'i lta bar song ba mi 'dor ba gnas nas phyung ba dang / khyim pa thams cad dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa ma yin pa thams cad do //
translated: those who have been ejected for not giving up a bad view, all householders, and all those who are not fully ordained.

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar rgan pa'i bca' ba mdzad pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis ji ltar rgan pa'i bca' ba mdzad pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the Blessed One instituted the rule of seniority,

original: dge slong rnams gcig la gcig bsnyen bkur byed /
analyzed: dge slong rnams gcig la gcig bsnyen bkur byed /
translated: The monks will respect each other.🔽

original: bla mar byed /🔽rjed par byed /🔽mchod par byed do //
analyzed: bla mar byed / rjed par byed / mchod par byed do //
translated: The monks served, venerated, revered, and worshipped one another.

original: de rnams gcig la gcig bsnyen bkur byed /🔽bla mar byed /🔽rjed par byed /
analyzed: de rnams gcig la gcig bsnyen bkur byed / bla mar byed / rjed par byed /
translated: They served, venerated, revered, and worshipped one another.

original: @283a *// mchod par byed pa na /
analyzed: @283a *// mchod par byed pa na /
translated: As they served, venerated, revered, and worshipped one another,

original: chu'i nang gi autpa la ji lta ba bzhin du dge ba'i chos kyis 'phel bar gyur to //🔽dge slong rnams the tshom skyes nas /
analyzed: chu'i nang gi autpa la ji lta ba bzhin du dge ba'i chos kyis 'phel bar gyur to // dge slong rnams the tshom skyes nas /
translated: they flourished like lotuses in the water.🔽The monks,

original: the tshom thams cad gcod pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
analyzed: the tshom thams cad gcod pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
translated: having doubts, asked the Blessed One, the Buddha, the one who removes all doubts,

analyzed: btsun pa / gang gi tshe ji ltar rgan pa'i bca' ba mdzad pa de'i tshe / dge slong rnams gcig la gcig bsnyen bkur bgyid /
translated: “Reverend, when the seating was arranged according to seniority,

original: bla mar bgyid /🔽rjed par bgyid /🔽mchod par bgyid do //
analyzed: bla mar bgyid / rjed par bgyid / mchod par bgyid do //
translated: the monks served, venerated, revered, and worshipped one another.

original: de rnams gcig la gcig bsnyen bkur bgyid /🔽bla mar bgyid /🔽rjed par bgyid /
analyzed: de rnams gcig la gcig bsnyen bkur bgyid / bla mar bgyid / rjed par bgyid /
translated: They served, venerated, revered, and worshipped one another.

original: mchod par bgyid pa na /
analyzed: mchod par bgyid pa na /
translated: As they served, venerated, revered, and worshipped one another,

original: chab kyi nang gi autpa la ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: chab kyi nang gi autpa la ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: they flourished like lotuses in the water.

original: dge ba'i chos kyis 'phel bar gyur pa la gzigs /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos kyis 'phel bar gyur pa la gzigs /
translated: and the virtuous ones flourish.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Monks,

original: da ltar nga 'dod chags dang bral /
analyzed: da ltar nga 'dod chags dang bral /
translated: now I am free from desire,

original: zhe sdang dang bral /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bral /
translated: free from anger,

original: gti mug dang bral /
analyzed: gti mug dang bral /
translated: free from ignorance,

original: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa las grol te /
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa las grol te /
translated: and free from birth, old age, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and anxiety.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa /
translated: I am omniscient,🔽I know everything,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa /
translated: I know all,

original: shes bya thams cad la mnga' brnyes pas ji ltar rgan pa'i bca' ba mdzad de /
analyzed: shes bya thams cad la mnga' brnyes pas ji ltar rgan pa'i bca' ba mdzad de /

original: ji ltar rgan pa de la brten nas dge slong rnams gcig la gcig bsnyen bkur byed /
analyzed: ji ltar rgan pa de la brten nas dge slong rnams gcig la gcig bsnyen bkur byed /
translated: The monks should respect each other according to seniority.

original: bla mar byed /
analyzed: bla mar byed /
translated: They should revere each other

original: ces bya ba nas chu'i nang gi autpa la ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba'i bar gang yin pa 'di la ngo mtshar zhig che /
analyzed: ces bya ba nas chu'i nang gi autpa la ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba'i bar gang yin pa 'di la ngo mtshar zhig che /
translated: and so forth, up to ‘It is amazing that this is so.’

original: gang gi tshe nga 'dod chags dang bcas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nga 'dod chags dang bcas /
translated: “When I was still subject to desire,

original: zhe sdang dang bcas /

translated: and had not been freed from birth, old age, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, anxiety, and strife, how could I have performed the duties of an elder?

analyzed: ji ltar rgan pa de la brten nas 'dzam bu gling na gnas pa'i skye bo'i tshogs phal cher sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i ris gya nom par skyes pa gang yin pa de nyon cig /

analyzed: bdag cag la phan tshun yid gcugs pas lhan cig gnas shing mthun pa dang / yang dag par dga' ba dang / rtsod pa med pa ni / yod na / 'on kyang bdag cag gis gang la bsnyen bkur bya / bla mar bya / rjed par bya /

original: glang po ches smras pa /
analyzed: glang po ches smras pa /
translated: The elephant said,

original: gal te de lta na /🔽kho bos ni /🔽glang po che dang / @286a *//
analyzed: gal te de lta na / kho bos ni / glang po che dang / @286a *//
translated: “If that is the case,🔽I will establish all the elephants,

analyzed: sengge dang / stag dang / gung thams cad rab tu dgod par bya'o //
translated: lions, tigers, and leopards.”

original: gong ma sreg gis smras pa /
analyzed: gong ma sreg gis smras pa /
translated: The peacock said,

original: gal te de lta na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na /
translated: “If that is the case,

analyzed: mdor na khyed kyis 'dul ba ma yin pa /
translated: in short, you are not my disciples.

original: rkang pa med pa dang / rkang gnyis pa dang / rkang bzhi pa dang / 'dab chags gang yin pa thams cad kho bos brtul zhugs kyi gzhi lnga la rab tu dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: rkang pa med pa dang / rkang gnyis pa dang / rkang bzhi pa dang / 'dab chags gang yin pa thams cad kho bos brtul zhugs kyi gzhi lnga la rab tu dgod par bya'o //
translated: I will establish all those without legs, with two legs, with four legs, and with many legs in the five precepts.”

original: de nas de rnams kyi yul ka shi na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba'i srog chags ji snyed pa de dag thams cad brtul zhugs kyi gzhi lnga la rab tu bkod do //
analyzed: de nas de rnams kyi yul ka shi na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba'i srog chags ji snyed pa de dag thams cad brtul zhugs kyi gzhi lnga la rab tu bkod do //
translated: Then, all the animals in the land of Kāśi who had been reborn as animals were established in the five precepts.

original: de rnams gcig la gcig gnod pa mi byed cing /
analyzed: de rnams gcig la gcig gnod pa mi byed cing /

original: nags stug po de na shes bzhin gyi gnas pas ci dga' bar gnas pa de rnams kyi mthus /
analyzed: nags stug po de na shes bzhin gyi gnas pas ci dga' bar gnas pa de rnams kyi mthus /
translated: They lived mindfully in the forest, and as they pleased.

original: lhas dus su char phab pas sa rtag tu me tog dang / 'bras bu'i shing dang / lo tog dang ldan par gyur to //
analyzed: lhas dus su char phab pas sa rtag tu me tog dang / 'bras bu'i shing dang / lo tog dang ldan par gyur to //
translated: By the power of their practice, the gods rained down at the right time, and the land was always filled with flowers, fruit trees, and crops.

original: mi rnams kyis de dag gcig la gcig gnod pa mi byed par gnas pas sa rtag tu me tog dang / 'bras bu'i shing dang / lo tog dang ldan par mthong ba dang / rgyal pos smras pa /
analyzed: mi rnams kyis de dag gcig la gcig gnod pa mi byed par gnas pas sa rtag tu me tog dang / 'bras bu'i shing dang / lo tog dang ldan par mthong ba dang / rgyal pos smras pa /
translated: The people saw that the land was always full of flowers, fruit trees, and crops, and that the people did not harm one another. The king said,

original: ngas chos bzhin gyis rgyal srid byas te; 'di ni /
analyzed: ngas chos bzhin gyis rgyal srid byas te; 'di ni /
translated: “I rule the kingdom in accordance with the Dharma. This is my power.”

original: nga'i mthu yin no //
analyzed: nga'i mthu yin no //

original: btsun mo dang / gzhon nu rnams dang / blon po rnams dang / khrom gyi ru ba rnams dang / grong mi dang / yul mi rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: btsun mo dang / gzhon nu rnams dang / blon po rnams dang / khrom gyi ru ba rnams dang / grong mi dang / yul mi rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: The queen, princes, ministers, merchants, townspeople, and country people all said,

original: 'di ni / bdag cag gi mthu yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni / bdag cag gi mthu yin no //
translated: “This is our power.”

original: rgyal pos bsam pa /
analyzed: rgyal pos bsam pa /
translated: The king thought,

analyzed: 'di dag thams cad / 'di ni / bdag gi mthu yin no //
translated: “All of these people🔽say, ‘This is my power.’

original: 'di ni / bdag gi mthu yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni / bdag gi mthu yin no //
translated: ‘This is my power.’

original: zhes smras na /
analyzed: zhes smras na /

analyzed: 'di su'i mthu yin pa mi shes so //

original: snyam @286b nas; de ngo mtshar skyes te /
analyzed: snyam @286b nas; de ngo mtshar skyes te /

analyzed: des ltas mkhan rnams bkug nas smras pa dang / de rnams kyis kyang ma shes so //

original: ji tsam na w'a ra n'a si dang ha cang yang mi ring ba'i skyed mos tshal zhig yod pa de na drang srong mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa zhig gnas te /
analyzed: ji tsam na w'a ra n'a si dang ha cang yang mi ring ba'i skyed mos tshal zhig yod pa de na drang srong mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa zhig gnas te /
translated: Not far from Vārāṇasī there was a park where a sage with the five superknowledges lived.

original: w'a ra n'a si na gnas pa'i skye bo'i tshogs mtha' dag gis mchod cing rjed cing mngon du smra bar bya ba zhig yod do //
analyzed: w'a ra n'a si na gnas pa'i skye bo'i tshogs mtha' dag gis mchod cing rjed cing mngon du smra bar bya ba zhig yod do //
translated: All the people living in Vārāṇasī made offerings to him, revered him, and spoke to him.

analyzed: de nas rgyal po drang srong de'i drung du song nas rkang pa gnyis la gtugs te smras pa /

analyzed: drang srong chen po //

analyzed: bdag gi yul na dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba'i srog chags ji snyed pa de dag thams cad gcig la gcig gnod pa mi byed cing /
translated: in my country, all the animals who have gone to the animal realm do not harm each other.

original: shes bzhin gyi gnas pas ci dga' bar gnas pas /
analyzed: shes bzhin gyi gnas pas ci dga' bar gnas pas /
translated: They live as they wish, mindfully abiding.

original: lhas dus su char phab pas /
analyzed: lhas dus su char phab pas /
translated: The gods rain down rain at the right time,

analyzed: sa rtag tu me tog dang / 'bras bu'i shing dang / lo tog dang ldan par gyur pa dang / bdag gis 'di snyam du sems te /

original: bdag gis chos bzhin gyis rgyal srid byas pas /
analyzed: bdag gis chos bzhin gyis rgyal srid byas pas /
translated: “I have ruled the kingdom according to the Dharma.

original: 'di ni / bdag gi mthu yin no snyam du sems so //
analyzed: 'di ni / bdag gi mthu yin no snyam du sems so //
translated: “This is my power,” he thinks.

analyzed: btsun mo dang / gzhon nu rnams dang / blon po rnams dang / khrom gyi ru ba dang / yul mi dang / grong mi rnams kyis kyang 'di ni /
translated: “This is our power,” think the queens, princes, ministers, townspeople, and country people.

original: bdag cag gi mthu yin no snyam du sems te /
analyzed: bdag cag gi mthu yin no snyam du sems te /
translated: “This is our power,” they think.

original: bdag kyang ngo mtshar chen po skyes na /
analyzed: bdag kyang ngo mtshar chen po skyes na /
translated: “If I am amazed,

analyzed: de'i phyir 'di su'i mthu lags pa the tshom gcad pa'i rigs so //

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /

original: rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po /

analyzed: 'di ni / khyod kyi mthu ma lags te / btsun mo'i ma lags / gzhon nu rnams kyi ma lags /

analyzed: blon po rnams kyi ma lags / khrom gyi ru ba'i ma lags / grong mi'i @287a *//

analyzed: gal te de ltar na /

analyzed: re zhig bltar mchi'o //

analyzed: rgyal po chen po /

original: rgyal pos smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal pos smras pa /

translated: When the king had taken up and practiced the five bases of training, the queens also took up and practiced the five bases of training.

translated: The minor kings of the realm heard that King Brahmadatta, together with his queens, princes, ministers, townspeople, and countrymen, had taken up the five bases of training and were practicing them.

original: thos nas de rnams kyang btsun mo rnams dang / gzhon nu rnams dang / blon po rnams dang / khrom gyi ru ba rnams dang / grong mi rnams dang / yul mi rnams dang lhan cig tu brtul zhugs kyi gzhi lnga yang dag par blangs te spyad par brtsams so //

translated: Hearing this, they too, together with their queens, princes, ministers, townspeople, and countrymen, began to take up and practice the five bases of training.

analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling gi skye bo'i tshogs thams cad las phal cher brtul zhugs kyi gzhi lnga yang dag par blangs te spyad par brtsams so //
translated: Most of the people of Jambudvīpa began to take up and practice the five bases of training.

analyzed: de'i tshe 'dzam bu'i gling pa 'chi ba'i dus byed pa de /

analyzed: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin gyis lha'i 'khor rgyas par mthong nas tshigs su bcad de smras pa /

analyzed: gus bcas zhe sar bcas pa dag /

analyzed: dka' thub tshal na gnas pa yi //

original: gong ma sreg gi tshangs spyod pa //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: “Monks,

original: 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'di ji snyam du sems /

analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus kyi gong ma sreg gang yin pa de ni /

original: nga nyid yin no //
analyzed: nga nyid yin no //
translated: is none other than me.

original: ri bong ni /
analyzed: ri bong ni /
translated: The rabbit

analyzed: dge slong sh'a ri'i bu yin no //

analyzed: kun dga' bo yin no //

analyzed: de'i tshe yang ngas rgan pa ji lta ba'i bca' ba mdzad de /
translated: At that time, too, I made the offering in the same way as the elder.

analyzed: dge slong dag /

analyzed: de lta bas na /

original: dge slong dag /

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: re zhig dge slong de /
analyzed: re zhig dge slong de /

translated: There is no deference, nor is anyone subject to fear.🔽This is not the place where the rules of proper conduct can flourish.🔽This is not the place where the rules of training can flourish if the rules of proper conduct do not flourish.

original: slob pa'i chos rnams yongs su ma rgyas par tshul khrims kyi phung po dang; ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po yongs su rgyas par 'gyur ba'i gnas 'di med do //
analyzed: slob pa'i chos rnams yongs su ma rgyas par tshul khrims kyi phung po dang; ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po yongs su rgyas par 'gyur ba'i gnas 'di med do //
translated: This is not the place where the aggregates of the Dharma—the aggregate of morality, the aggregate of concentration, the aggregate of wisdom, the aggregate of freedom, and the aggregate of the knowledge and vision of freedom—can flourish if the rules of training do not flourish.

original: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po yongs su ma rgyas par len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i gnas 'di med do //🔽dge slong dag /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po yongs su ma rgyas par len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i gnas 'di med do // dge slong dag /
translated: It is impossible that one who has not fully developed the aggregate of seeing the wisdom of liberation will attain nirvana without grasping.🔽Monks,🔽if a monk

original: re zhig dge slong de /🔽tshangs pa @288b mtshungs par spyod pa'i gnas brtan dang / bar ma dang / gsar bu rnams la bkur sti dang bcas /
analyzed: re zhig dge slong de / tshangs pa @288b mtshungs par spyod pa'i gnas brtan dang / bar ma dang / gsar bu rnams la bkur sti dang bcas /
translated: resides with respect,

original: zhe sa dang bcas /
analyzed: zhe sa dang bcas /
translated: reverence,

original: 'jigs pa'i dbang du 'gro ba dang bcas pas gnas na /
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i dbang du 'gro ba dang bcas pas gnas na /
translated: and fear of wrongdoing toward the elders,🔽the middling, and the newly ordained among his companions in the celibate life,

original: kun tu spyod pa'i chos yongs su rgyas par 'gyur ba'i gnas 'di yod do //
analyzed: kun tu spyod pa'i chos yongs su rgyas par 'gyur ba'i gnas 'di yod do //
translated: it is possible that the rules of conduct will be fully developed.

original: kun tu spyod pa'i chos yongs su rgyas na /
analyzed: kun tu spyod pa'i chos yongs su rgyas na /
translated: If the rules of conduct are fully developed,

original: slob pa'i chos rnams yongs su rgyas par 'gyur ba'i gnas 'di yod do //
analyzed: slob pa'i chos rnams yongs su rgyas par 'gyur ba'i gnas 'di yod do //
translated: it is possible that the qualities of training will be fully developed.

original: slob pa'i chos rnams yongs su rgyas na /
analyzed: slob pa'i chos rnams yongs su rgyas na /
translated: If the qualities of training are fully developed,

original: tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po yongs su rgyas par 'gyur ba'i gnas 'di yod do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phung po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / shes rab kyi phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po yongs su rgyas par 'gyur ba'i gnas 'di yod do //
translated: and the aggregate of the wisdom of liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po yongs su rgyas na /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po yongs su rgyas na /
translated: When the aggregate of the wisdom of liberation is complete,

original: len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i gnas 'di yod do //
analyzed: len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i gnas 'di yod do //
translated: one will attain nirvāṇa without grasping.

original: dge slong dag /
analyzed: dge slong dag /
translated: Bhikṣus,

original: de lta bas na /
analyzed: de lta bas na /
translated: therefore,

original: 'di ltar bslab par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bslab par bya ste /
translated: you should train by thinking,🔽‘I will live with respect,🔽reverence,🔽and fear for the elders,

original: gnas brtan dang / bar ma dang / gsar bu rnams la bkur sti dang bcas /
analyzed: gnas brtan dang / bar ma dang / gsar bu rnams la bkur sti dang bcas /
translated: the middle monks,🔽and the junior monks.’

original: zhe sa dang bcas /🔽'jigs pa'i dbang du 'gro ba dang bcas pas gnas par bya ste; dge slong dag /
analyzed: zhe sa dang bcas / 'jigs pa'i dbang du 'gro ba dang bcas pas gnas par bya ste; dge slong dag /
translated: Bhikṣus,

original: khyed kyis de lta bu la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: khyed kyis de lta bu la bslab par bya'o //
translated: you should train in that way.”

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis lnga sde btul ba de rnams dgon pa na gnas pa na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis lnga sde btul ba de rnams dgon pa na gnas pa na /
translated: When the Blessed One had converted the group of five, they lived in the forest.

original: sengge dang / stag dang / gung dang / chom rkun pa rnams kyis bgrod par gyur to //
analyzed: sengge dang / stag dang / gung dang / chom rkun pa rnams kyis bgrod par gyur to //
translated: Lions, tigers, leopards, and robbers came to the place.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa /
translated: The Blessed One thought,

original: gang du sngon gyi yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi nyan thos rnams kyis gnas rung bar gyur snyam na /
analyzed: gang du sngon gyi yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi nyan thos rnams kyis gnas rung bar gyur snyam na /
translated: “Where did the hearers of the past perfect buddhas live?”

original: gtsug @289a *// lag khang yin par gzigs so //
analyzed: gtsug @289a *// lag khang yin par gzigs so //
translated: He saw that it was in monasteries.

original: lha rnams kyis kyang de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
analyzed: lha rnams kyis kyang de bzhin du bcom ldan 'das la gsol to //
translated: The gods also requested the Blessed One to do the same.

original: de'i tshe w'a ra n'a si na khyim bdag dge bzang zhes bya ba zhig gnas pa de dge ba'i rtsa ba des sems kyi rgyud bskul nas 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de'i tshe w'a ra n'a si na khyim bdag dge bzang zhes bya ba zhig gnas pa de dge ba'i rtsa ba des sems kyi rgyud bskul nas 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: At that time, in Vārāṇasī, there lived a householder named Bhadraśubha. His mind was inspired by the roots of virtue and he thought,

original: kye ma'o // bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos rnams kyi gtsug lag khang brtsig go //
analyzed: kye ma'o // bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos rnams kyi gtsug lag khang brtsig go //
translated: “Oh! I will build a monastery for the hearers of the Blessed One.”

original: snyam nas / de nang par sngar langs te /
analyzed: snyam nas / de nang par sngar langs te /
translated: He got up early in the morning

original: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der song nas phyin pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der song nas phyin pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag byas te phyogs gcig tu 'dug go //
translated: He went to the Blessed One, and upon his arrival he bowed his head at the Blessed One’s feet and then sat down to one side.

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug pa dang; bcom ldan 'das kyis khyim bdag dge bzang la /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug pa dang; bcom ldan 'das kyis khyim bdag dge bzang la /
translated: When he had sat down to one side, the Blessed One gave the householder Bhadrika

original: chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par ston par mdzad /🔽yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par mdzad /🔽yang dag par gzengs bstod par mdzad /
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par ston par mdzad / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par mdzad / yang dag par gzengs bstod par mdzad /
translated: a discourse on the Dharma that was instructive,🔽inspiring,🔽gladdening,

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad de /🔽rnam grangs du mar chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par bstan /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad de / rnam grangs du mar chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par bstan /
translated: and delightful.

original: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug /
translated: Having given him a discourse on the Dharma that was instructive,

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod /
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: inspiring,🔽gladdening,

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas cang mi gsung ngo //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas cang mi gsung ngo //
translated: and delightful, he remained silent.

original: de nas khyim bdag dge bzang stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas /
analyzed: de nas khyim bdag dge bzang stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas /
translated: Then the householder Bhadrika rose from his seat, draped his upper robe over one shoulder,

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud de /
translated: He bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined,

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: and said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gal te gnang na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gal te gnang na /
translated: “Blessed One, if you allow it,

original: 'di ltar bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos rnams kyi gtsug @289b lag khang rtsig lags so //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos rnams kyi gtsug @289b lag khang rtsig lags so //
translated: I will build a temple for the Blessed One’s hearers.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: khyim bdag / de lta bas na /
analyzed: khyim bdag / de lta bas na /
translated: “Householder, that being so,

original: rjes su gnang gi /
analyzed: rjes su gnang gi /
translated: I allow it.🔽Build it.”

original: rtsigs shig / des ci 'dra ba rtsig pa ma shes nas /
analyzed: rtsigs shig / des ci 'dra ba rtsig pa ma shes nas /
translated: Not knowing what kind of temple to build,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; gal te gnas khang gsum brtsigs na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; gal te gnas khang gsum brtsigs na /
translated: the Blessed One said, “If you build three temples,

original: dbus su dri gtsang khang brtsig par bya zhing /
analyzed: dbus su dri gtsang khang brtsig par bya zhing /
translated: you should build a temple for the Buddha in the middle,
